purpleculture_pinyin:
chù
to touch; to make contact with sth; to stir up sb's emotions
трогать; вступить в контакт с кем-нибудь; возбуждать чьи-то эмоции
rtega_mnemonic:
觸觸RS
触触		butt, ram, gore, touch
  • insect 蜀/虫 ramming it's horns 角 into something: feels like something touches you
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 触)
Pictophonetic: 蜀 indicates the sound; 角 (horn) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
觸動 [ chù dòng ]: to touch; to stir up (trouble or emotions); to move (sb's emotions or worry)
觸犯 [ chù fàn ]: to violate; to offend
觸及 [ chù jí ]: to touch (physically, one's feelings etc); to touch on (a topic)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 角 [ jiǎo ] angle, corner; horn, horn-shaped
    • 蜀 [ shǔ ] the name of an ancient state
heisig_chinese_memo: For insects to get in touch with each other and avoid obstacles like a butterfly net, they need to place their antennae at just the right angle and wrap them just to be safe.
Ru_trainchinese: chù: (глаг) дотрагиваться, касаться; ударяться о, сталкиваться с; затрагивать, задевать (чьи-л. чувства)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: For insects to get in touch with each other, they need to place their antennae at just the right angle and wrap them just to be safe.
humanum_full_description_en:
The sound of " touch " from " corner ", " shu ", the original meaning of collision with the horn, so it means conflict. "Shuowen": "Struck, reach. From the angle, the sound of Shu." "Huainanzi. "Qi Su": "The proverb says: "The bird is poor, the beast is poor, the beast is poor, and the man is deceitful."" "Jade Pian": "The ancient text touches." It means that the bird is forced to desperate and will peck with the beak. , Beasts are forced to desperate and will hit their heads, and people are forced to defraud (Zhao Zongyi).

Bronze writing is used as a person's name.
humanum_short_description_en: "To touch " means to collide with a corner, and the original meaning is to collide and contradict.
humanum_full_description:
「觸」從「角」，「蜀」聲，本義用角頂撞，故有抵觸之意。《說文》：「觸，抵也。从角，蜀聲。」《淮南子．齊俗》：「諺曰：『鳥窮則噣，獸窮則𧢻，人窮則詐。』」《玉篇》：「𧢻，古文觸。」意謂鳥被逼得走投無路就會用喙啄，獸被逼得走投無路就會用頭撞，人被逼得走投無路就會詐騙（趙宗乙）。

　　金文用作人名。
humanum_short_description: 「觸」表示用角頂撞，本義是頂觸、抵觸。

觸犯 [ chù fàn ]: to violate; to offend

「 觸 」從「 角 」，「 蜀 」聲，本義用角頂撞，故有抵觸之意。《說文》：「觸，抵也。从角，蜀聲。」《淮南子．齊俗》：「諺曰：『鳥窮則噣，獸窮則𧢻，人窮則詐。』」《玉篇》：「𧢻，古文觸。」意謂鳥被逼得走投無路就會用喙啄，獸被逼得走投無路就會用頭撞，人被逼得走投無路就會詐騙（趙宗乙）。 金文用作人名。
The sound of " touch" from " corner", " shu", the original meaning of collision with the horn, so it means conflict. "Shuowen": "Struck, reach. From the angle, the sound of Shu." "Huainanzi. "Qi Su": "The proverb says: "The bird is poor, the beast is poor, the beast is poor, and the man is deceitful."" "Jade Pian": "The ancient text touches." It means that the bird is forced to desperate and will peck with the beak. , Beasts are forced to desperate and will hit their heads, and people are forced to defraud (Zhao Zongyi). Bronze writing is used as a person's name.

觸字的基本解释

觸
chù
见“触”。

觸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chù］
［《廣韻》尺玉切，入燭，昌。］
“1”的今字。“触1”的繁体字。
(1)用角顶物。
(2)撞，碰。
(3)接触。
(4)遇到；遭受。
(5)触动；引起。
(6)触犯，冒犯。
(7)距离。
(8)佛教语。六尘之一，即身根所生之感受。
(9)古代寓言中的小国名。参见“觸蠻”。
(10)通“濁”。
(11)姓。战国赵有触龙。见《史记·赵世家》。

觸字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【角字部】　觸； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1145第11
〔古文〕?【唐韻】尺玉切【集韻】【韻會】樞玉切，?衝入聲。【說文】牴也。【易·大壯】羝羊觸籓。【前漢·元帝紀】去禮義，觸?法。【荀子·議兵篇】觸之者角摧。【揚子·太?經】星辰不相觸。　又【玉篇】據也。【增韻】污也。　又觸衣。【本草綱目】褌襠，一名觸衣。　又人名。【左傳·襄十一年】鄭人賂晉侯以師觸。【註】樂師名。　又姓。【史記·趙世家】左師觸龍。　又【集韻】昌句切，芻去聲。亦牴也。【揚雄·羽獵賦】票禽之紲踰，犀兕之牴觸，熊羆之拏攫，虎豹之凌遽。觸叶遽，遽音詎。師古讀。　【集韻】亦作觕。

考證：〔【揚雄·校獵賦】票禽之紲踰，犀兕之抵觸。〕　謹照原 書校獵賦改羽獵賦。
觸字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
觸字的起名意思

暂无。

touch
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chù］
["Guangyun" ruler jade cut, into the candle, prosperous. ]
The present character of "1". "Touch 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Use corner tops.
(2) Bump, bump.
(3) Contact.
(4) Encounter; suffer.
(5) Touch; cause.
(6) Offense, offense.
(7) Distance.
(8) Buddhist language. One of the six dusts is the feeling born from the root of the body.
(9) The name of a small country in ancient fables. See "touch barbarian".
(10) Through "turbidity".
(11) Last name. During the Warring States Period, Zhao Youzhilong. See "Historical Records · Family of Zhao".
